text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen today 
I'm going to show you how tight people do mixed

vegetables now the term mixed veg often conjure 
up this image of a bowl of bland boring steamed

vegetables that come from a frozen bag well 
this will change forever the way you look at

mixed vegetables this dish is called pad pak ruam 
Pad means to stir-fry pak means vegetables and ruam is

mixed so it's pretty straightforward and it's so 
good I've actually had people request this dish

many times so let's get started vegetable choices 
so there are no rules about what vegetables you

should be using but you should get a mix of colors 
and textures ok because you don't want the whole

thing to be green or the whole thing to be leafy 
so I'm going to show you what I like and what's

commonly used in Thailand so I've got here some 
cabbage some carrots and the way I cut my carrot

is called a roll cut it makes really interesting 
looking pieces so you basically cut at a 45 degree

angle and you keep rolling it and cutting through 
the Cutt surface some cauliflower make sure the

florets are small you don't want big trees in the 
bowl now over here I've got some shitake mushrooms

which I just cut into big issue Isis these are 
fresh shiitake sugar snap peas some legumes for

some extra protein make sure you remove the string 
that's on the side of the peas and then I just cut

them in half on a bias and then this is guilin 
stem or chinese broccoli now the stems I cut

into thin pieces like this and then the leaves I 
just roughly tear them into bite-size pieces and

I keep them separate so the way I have them right 
now is sort of how the order in which they go in

so the cabbage can go in with this bowl here if it 
will fit that's another key of making good mixed

vegetables too is you don't you time the adding 
of the vegetables so that everything come out

perfectly done so this is going to go in first 
followed by that and then the leafy stuff that

doesn't take very long now out the sauce really 
simple I've got some oyster sauce right here if

you are vegetarian and you want to make this a 
vegetarian dish you could also use vegetarian

oyster sauce which they sell sometimes they call 
it vegetarian stir-fry sauce just look at the

bottle if it's got sort of a thick texture like 
oyster sauce that's what it's meant to replace

then I've also got some soy sauce so this is 
Thai healthy boy mushroom soy sauce my standard

ones that I always go to for stir fries I've got 
products that I used listed on my website as well

so I'll put the link to that paste you can go and 
take a close look at these sauces but you can use

really any kind of soy sauce I've also got some 
golden mountain sauce which is a different kind

of soy sauce it's darker and richer just adds a 
little bit of a complexity I'm gonna add just a

little bit of water you don't have to add at 
this point but I find I always need a little

extra water during the stir-fry so I figured why 
not just add it here make it a little easier now

this sauce is not spicy but I like to make it 
a little spicy by adding some chilies I've got

some Thai chilies here I'm not gonna finely chop 
them because I actually like the pops of red they

provide so what I'll do is I'll just crush them 
this way those sort of gently infuse into the

sauce as you stir-fry so you know you'll get 
a little bit of spiciness and then this way no

one's going to accidentally eat a piece of chili 
because it's so big right you can't really miss

that okay so I'm going to add that to my garlic 
together and we're ready to cook got a wok here

you can use a big saute pan if you want a little 
bit of vegetable oil as always and I'm going to

go in with the garlic and the chilies now I'm 
using a lot of garlic because you can never have

enough garlic and as you can see it's just it's 
mixed Vettes right so you're really bits little

things like garlic and chili that's gonna make it 
interesting and delicious okay so get that Brown

just a little just until the garlic starches her 
and golden smallest bits of garlic are starting

to brown we're going with the hard vegetables 
first so carrots and cauliflower give them a

head start because they take a little long if you 
heat is really high and you feel that the garlic

is going to Brown too quickly a little splash of 
water to cool it down Meadowhall also helps steam

the cauliflower and the carrot and cook them a 
little faster so give the cauliflower about a

minute and this is why it's important to not cut 
your cauliflower big because otherwise it will

take forever okay now the medium hard vegetables 
so that's our cabbage mushrooms guilin stems and

the snow peas and then I'm also going to add 
the sauce right at this point and now just

give everything it's hot until they're almost 
done a little sugar just to cut the saltiness

just a teaspoon mmm that looks good already how 
done you like the vegetables is sort of up to you

whether you like the softer cook them longer if 
you like them crunchy you know a couple minutes

will do what I'm looking for is when the cabbage 
starts to become soft that's when I pull it off

for me okay but for you it might be different go 
to depending on how you like the vegetables the

harder parts of the cabbage is starting to be 
soft now so I am good I'm going to go in with

the last thing which is our leafy greens that 
guy'll on leaves looks like a lot bit of a will

now don't be too eager to add water if it looks 
dry because as the vegetables cook they will give

off quite a bit of liquid so what looks drying 
now might not be dry in just a few seconds okay

that's it whoa that chilies always have this with 
some jasmine rice and by the way this is jasmine

rice that I just cooked on the stove without a 
rice cooker and if you want to know how to do

that I have a video for that so as you can see as 
it sits there's quite a bit of sauce that comes

out right so stir fries always do this there's 
always more sauce than you think there is over

my right here especially that's sauce and this 
goes well with any Thai dish and this is one

of those things that's high people have when we 
just need some vegetables on the table you know

hmm oh who knew vegetables could be this good 
seriously it's just a bunch of vegetables

carefully selected and a few sauces and 
it will change forever the way you look at

mixed vegetables crunchy lots of texture going on 
garlicky and a little spicy man this isn't even a

side dish I can just have this with rice in there 
that's my dinner super healthy too so the recipe

as always is on hotThaikitchen.com when you 
make it send me a photo I love seeing your photos

as always on facebook twitter or instagram and 
if you haven't subscribed the show do so right

here so you never miss an episode and I will 
see you next time for your next delicious type
